condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.4: Children and women in humanitarian situations have timely and sustained access to quality preventive and rehabilitative nutrition services and support

description.narrative: Five states - Borno, Adamawa, Yobe, Bayelsa and Akwa Ibom - have updated nutrition emergency preparedness and response plans in 2019 and treated 1242,379 severe malnutrition cases in 1,063 treatment facilities and with 93% of the facilities reaching more than 75% of cure rate, well above national and international standard. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of UNICEF-targeted children aged 6 to 59 months in humanitarian situations affected by SAM admitted for treatment
Number of UNICEF- supported states with annually updated nutrition emergency preparedness and response plans
Number of UNICEF-targeted caregivers of children aged 0 to 23 months in humanitarian situations who received IYCF counselling
Percentage of health facilities that provide treatment services for the management of SAM
Percentage of health facilities reaching more than 75% of cure rate for the management of SAM
Existence of an emergency preparedness plan for nutrition
